video.title: All about GRAND Stack: GraphQL, React, Apollo, and Neo4j
video.description:
In this presentation, we explore application development using the GRAND stack (GraphQL, React, Apollo, Neo4j) for building web applications backed by a graph database.

This talk will review the components to build a simple web application, including how to build a React component, an introduction to JSX, an overview of GraphQL and why it is a game-changer for front-end development, and we'll learn how to model, store, and query data in the Neo4j graph database using GraphQL to power our web application.

Talk by William Lyon (http://twitter.com/lyonwj), Developer Relations Engineer at Neo4j

Recorded by Pusher.com. Check them out if you want awesome real-time tools, and subscribe to the their YouTube channel for more talks!

Pusher's channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoyqucxoFXDFnh3khD0rjUg

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.text: How does the GRAND stack fit with Next.js?

topLevelComment.author: Afolabi Aiyeloja
topLevelComment.text: I'm just starting to learn about the Grand stack and was wondering does Prisma fit within the stack. Also what are the best resources for learning about graphical databases?

topLevelComment.author: getparadox
topLevelComment.text: Ironically, because of client needs, I've been moving from MEAN back to LAMP. In the end, we all have to focus on the MONEY Stack.

topLevelComment.author: William Lyon
topLevelComment.text: If you're looking for an excuse to build a GRANDstack app, this online hackathon is running through the end of June: https://blog.grandstack.io/announcing-the-grandstack-online-hackathon-for-graphql-europe-2018-7d256ebf68e1
